impede.英释: to make it difficult for someone or something to move forward or make progress

thesis.英释: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

fridge.英释: a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment, used for keeping food and drinks cool

immune.中释: 免除的；安全的，不受影响的
immune.英释: not affected by something that happens or is done

stitch.中释: 缝纫；缝线；(肋部)突然剧痛
stitch.英释: a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth

format.英释: the way in which something such as a television show or meeting is organized or arranged

trench.英释: a long narrow hole dug into the surface of the ground

expose.中释: 揭发, 使暴露，使曝光"
expose.英释: to show the truth about someone or something, especially when it is bad

unfold.英释: if you unfold something that was folded, or if it unfolds, it opens out

refine.英释: to make a substance purer using an industrial process

fetter.英释: to restrict someone’s freedom and prevent them from doing what they want

reckon.英释: to guess a number or amount, without calculating it exactly

client.中释: 律师等的当事人，委托人；商店的顾客
client.英释: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

module.中释: 量度单位；建筑用的标准部件
module.英释: one of the separate units that a course of study has been divided into. Usually students choose a number of modules to study

snatch.英释: If you snatch something or snatch at something, you take it or pull it away quickly

grieve.英释: to feel extremely sad, especially because someone you love has died

vanish.英释: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

manual.英释: a book that gives instructions about how to do something, especially how to use a machine

static.英释: noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

retail.英释: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else

slight.英释: to offend someone by treating them rudely or without respect

mildew.英释: a white or grey substance that grows on walls or other surfaces in wet, slightly warm conditions

marvel.中释: 令人惊奇的事；创造奇迹
marvel.英释: You can describe something or someone as a marvel to indicate that you think that they are wonderful

fulfil.英释: to do or provide what is necessary or needed

uneasy.英释: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

resign.英释: to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization

parade.中释: 阅兵整队；列队行进，游行；夸耀；炫示
parade.英释: to walk or march together to celebrate or protest about something

dearth.英释: a situation in which there are very few of something that people want or need

revolt.英释: a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws

agenda.英释: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

paddle.英释: to move a small light boat through water, using one or more paddles

clutch.英释: the  pedal  that you press with your foot when driving a vehicle in order to change  gear  , or the part of the vehicle that this controls

female.英释: an animal that belongs to the sex that can have babies or produce eggs

ribbon.英释: a narrow piece of attractive cloth that you use, for example, to tie your hair or hold things together

aerial.中释: 空气的；空中的 (无线电)天线
aerial.英释: in or moving through the air

flabby.英释: used to describe something that is weak or not effective

devise.英释: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

slogan.英释: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used in advertisements, or by politicians, organizations etc

triple.英释: to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this

coarse.英释: having a rough surface that feels slightly hard

resume.中释: 重新开始；继续；重新占用
resume.英释: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

custom.英释: something that is done by people in a particular society because it is traditional

marble.中释: 大理石，(游戏用的)玻璃弹子
marble.英释: a type of hard rock that becomes smooth when it is polished, and is used for making buildings,  statue s  etc

enzyme.英释: a chemical substance that is produced in a plant or animal, and helps chemical changes to take place in the plant or animal

falter.英释: to speak in a voice that sounds weak and uncertain, and keeps stopping

throat.英释: the passage from the back of your mouth to the top of the tubes that go down to your lungs and stomach

accuse.英释: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

cement.英释: If things are cemented together, they are stuck or fastened together

inject.英释: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

profit.英释: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid

square.英释: a shape with four straight equal sides with 90˚ angles at the corners

meddle.英释: to deliberately try to influence or change a situation that does not concern you, or that you do not understand

drench.英释: to make something or someone extremely wet

invade.英释: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

extort.英释: to illegally force someone to give you something, especially money, by threatening them

deduce.英释: to use the knowledge and information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion about it

recite.英释: to say a poem, piece of literature etc that you have learned, for people to listen to

aspire.英释: to desire and work towards achieving something important

circus.英释: a group of people and animals who travel to different places performing skilful tricks as entertainment

convey.英释: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

robust.英释: a robust person is strong and healthy

mirage.英释: an effect caused by hot air in a desert, which makes you think that you can see objects when they are not actually there

elicit.英释: to succeed in getting information or a reaction from someone, especially when this is difficult

medium.英释: of middle size, level, or amount

ripple.英释: to move in small waves, or to make something move in this way

recipe.英释: a set of instructions for cooking a particular type of food

warden.英释: a person who is responsible for a particular place and whose job is to make sure its rules are obeyed

purity.英释: the quality or state of being pure

tissue.中释: 生理组织；薄纸；棉纸；织物；一套
tissue.英释: light thin paper used for wrapping, packing etc

kernel.英释: the part of a nut or seed inside the shell, or the part inside the stone of some fruits

solemn.英释: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

morbid.英释: with a strong and unhealthy interest in unpleasant subjects, especially death

rotate.英释: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this

insane.英释: completely stupid or crazy, often in a way that is dangerous

assess.英释: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

staple.中释: 主要产品；名产；纤维；主要成分，主食
staple.英释: a food that is needed and used all the time

engage.中释: 雇用；从事；订婚；吸引；啮合
engage.英释: to attract someone’s attention and keep them interested

truant.英释: a student who stays away from school without permission

delete.英释: to remove something that has been written down or stored in a computer

nuance.英释: a very slight, hardly noticeable difference in manner, colour, meaning etc

asylum.英释: protection given to someone by a government because they have escaped from fighting or political trouble in their own country

casual.中释: 偶然的，碰巧的；随便的；临时的
casual.英释: not formal or not for a formal situation

permit.英释: an official written statement giving you the right to do something

dreary.英释: dull and making you feel sad or bored

layoff.英释: When there are layoffs in a company, people become unemployed because there is no more work for them in the company

stress.英释: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

comply.英释: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

patent.英释: to obtain a special document giving you the right to make or sell a new  invention  or product

airing.英释: an occasion when an opinion, idea etc is discussed

drowse.英释: to be in a light sleep or to feel as though you are almost asleep

aupair.中释: 国外来的(姑娘)帮助料理家务换取住宿的

trifle.中释: 小事，无价值的东西；少量的钱

oblige.中释: (以誓言或契约等)束缚某人；施惠

versus.英释: used to show that two people or teams are competing against each other in a game or court case

scroll.英释: a long piece of paper that can be rolled up, and is used as an official document

outset.英释: at or from the beginning of an event or process

locker.英释: A locker is a small metal or wooden cabinet with a lock, where you can put your personal possessions, for example in a school, place of work, or sports club

upkeep.英释: the process of keeping something in good condition

viable.英释: able to continue to live or to develop into a living thing

fusion.英释: A fusion of different qualities, ideas, or things is something new that is created by joining them together

unrest.英释: a political situation in which people protest or behave violently

poster.英释: a large printed notice, picture, or photograph, used to advertise something or as a decoration

meadow.英释: a field with wild grass and flowers

pamper.英释: to look after someone very kindly, for example by giving them the things that they want and making them feel warm and comfortable

ragged.中释: 褴褛的，外形参差不齐的
ragged.英释: wearing clothes that are old and torn

attach.英释: to fasten or connect one object to another

galaxy.英释: one of the large groups of stars that make up the universe

valley.英释: an area of lower land between two lines of hills or mountains, usually with a river flowing through it

picnic.英释: if you have a picnic, you take food and eat it outdoors, especially in the country

dazzle.英释: if a very bright light dazzles you, it stops you from seeing properly for a short time

plight.英释: a very bad situation that someone is in

denial.英释: a statement saying that something is not true

native.英释: a native ability is one that you have naturally from birth

survey.中释: 环视，眺望；测量；勘定；检查；概述
survey.英释: a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

chorus.英释: a large group of people who sing together

wicked.英释: behaving in a way that is morally wrong

crisis.英释: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

reward.英释: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard

outlaw.英释: to completely stop something by making it illegal

chisel.英释: a metal tool with a sharp edge, used to cut wood or stone

dilate.英释: if a hollow part of your body dilates or if something dilates it, it becomes wider

plague.英释: a disease that causes death and spreads quickly to a large number of people

clinic.英释: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment is given to people who do not need to stay in the hospital

nickel.英释: a hard silver-white metal that is often combined with other metals, for example to make steel. It is a chemical element: symbol Ni

expire.英释: if an official document expires, it can no longer be legally used

sacred.英释: relating to a god or religion

oblong.英释: An oblong is a shape which has two long sides and two short sides and in which all the angles are right angles

pacify.英释: to make someone calm, quiet, and satisfied after they have been angry or upset

carton.英释: a small box made of  cardboard  or plastic that contains food or a drink

perish.英释: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

linger.英释: to stay somewhere a little longer, especially because you do not want to leave

toddle.英释: if a small child toddles, it walks with short, unsteady steps

census.英释: an official process of counting a country’s population and finding out about the people

pounce.英释: the act of pouncing; a spring or swoop

potent.英释: having a very powerful effect or influence on your body or mind

tropic.英释: one of the two imaginary lines around the world, either the Tropic of Cancer which is 23.5˚ north of the  equator  , or the Tropic of Capricorn which is 23.5˚ south of the equator

plough.英释: a piece of farm equipment used to turn over the earth so that seeds can be planted

absorb.英释: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

parody.英释: a piece of writing, music etc or an action that copies someone or something in an amusing way

decent.中释: 正当的，合适的；文雅的，尚可的
decent.英释: following moral standards that are acceptable to society

layman.英释: someone who is not trained in a particular subject or type of work, especially when they are being compared with someone who is

settle.英释: to end an argument or solve a disagreement

foster.英释: to take someone else’s child into your family for a period of time but without becoming their legal parent

accord.英释: a situation in which two people, ideas, or statements agree with each other

starch.英释: a substance which provides your body with energy and is found in foods such as grain, rice, and potatoes, or a food that contains this substance

anchor.中释: 锚；危难时可依靠的人或物；用锚泊船
anchor.英释: a piece of heavy metal that is lowered to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc to prevent a ship or boat moving

vacuum.英释: a space that is completely empty of all gas, especially one from which all the air has been taken away

stride.英释: a long step you make while you are walking

troupe.英释: a group of singers, actors, dancers etc who work together

ascent.英释: the act of climbing something or moving upwards

kidney.英释: one of the two organs in your lower back that separate waste products from your blood and make urine

sprawl.中释: 植物蔓生；城市无计划扩张

depict.英释: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

grease.英释: to put butter, grease etc on a pan etc to prevent food from sticking to it

temper.英释: to make something less severe or extreme

jagged.中释: 边缘不整齐的，参差不齐的

amount.英释: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

shabby.中释: 破旧的，褴褛的，卑鄙的，不公平的
shabby.英释: shabby clothes, places, or objects are untidy and in bad condition because they have been used for a long time

insure.英释: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc

debris.英释: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

emerge.英释: to appear or come out from somewhere

nicety.英释: a small detail or point of difference, especially one that is usually considered to be part of the correct way of doing something

remind.英释: to make someone remember something that they must do

potion.英释: A potion is a drink that contains medicine, poison, or something that is supposed to have magic powers

digest.英释: a short piece of writing that gives the most important facts from a book, report etc

colony.英释: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

repent.英释: to be sorry for something and wish you had not done it – used especially when considering your actions in a religious way

liable.中释: 有倾向的；可能遭受的；有责任的
liable.英释: legally responsible for the cost of something

sphere.中释: 球，球面；天体；(兴趣,活动,势力等)范围 "

submit.英释: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

access.英释: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place

crater.英释: a round hole in the ground made by something that has fallen on it or by an explosion

charge.中释: 指控；控告；冲锋；要价；充电
charge.英释: to state officially that someone may be guilty of a crime

splash.英释: If you splash around or splash about in water, you hit or disturb the water in a noisy way, causing some of it to fly up into the air

modest.中释: 谦让的，适度的；有礼貌的
modest.英释: A modest house or other building is not large or expensive

muster.英释: if soldiers muster, or if someone musters them, they come together in a group

decree.英释: an official order or decision, especially one made by the ruler of a country

ritual.英释: done as part of a rite or ritual

flaunt.英释: to show your money, success, beauty etc so that other people notice it – used to show disapproval

severe.英释: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

excess.英释: Excess is used to refer to additional amounts of money that need to be paid for services and activities that were not originally planned or taken into account

corpse.英释: the dead body of a person

entity.英释: something that exists as a single and complete unit

wander.英释: to walk away from where you are supposed to stay

quaint.英释: unusual and attractive, especially in an old-fashioned way

swerve.英释: to make a sudden sideways movement while moving forwards, usually in order to avoid hitting something

opaque.英释: opaque glass or liquid is difficult to see through and often thick

patrol.英释: to go around the different parts of an area or building at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger

shower.英释: a piece of equipment that you stand under to wash your whole body

artery.英释: one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body

resort.英释: when you must use or depend on something because nothing better is available

myriad.英释: a very large number of things

scheme.英释: a clever plan, especially to do something that is bad or illegal – used in order to show disapproval

pimple.英释: a small raised red spot on your skin, especially on your face

vacant.中释: 空的；未被占用的；空虚的，无表情的
vacant.英释: a vacant seat, building, room or piece of land is empty and available for someone to use

motion.中释: 运动，动态；手势；眼色，姿势；提议
motion.英释: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

coward.英释: someone who is not at all brave

gamble.英释: to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be

signal.英释: a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something

pillow.英释: a cloth bag filled with soft material that you put your head on when you are sleeping

subdue.中释: 使屈服、征服，克制；使柔和，使安静
subdue.英释: to defeat or control a person or group, especially using force

stripe.英释: a line of colour, especially one of several lines of colour all close together

mobile.英释: moving or able to move from one job, area, or social class to another

novice.英释: someone who has no experience in a skill, subject, or activity

chaste.中释: 有道德的；善良的；贞洁的；简朴的
chaste.英释: not having sex with anyone, or not with anyone except your husband or wife

treaty.英释: a formal written agreement between two or more countries or governments

mammal.英释: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

fickle.英释: someone who is fickle is always changing their mind about people or things that they like, so that you cannot depend on them – used to show disapproval

salute.英释: an act of raising your right hand to your head as a sign of respect, usually done by a soldier to an officer

fabric.英释: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

summon.英释: to order someone to come to a place

exotic.英释: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

single.英释: a game, especially in tennis, in which one person plays on their own against another person

mantle.中释: 斗篷，披风；覆盖物，(煤气灯)白热罩
mantle.英释: a loose piece of outer clothing without sleeves, worn especially in former times

insert.英释: printed pages that are put inside a newspaper or magazine in order to advertise something

studio.英释: a room where television and radio programmes are made and broadcast or where music is recorded

elapse.英释: if a particular period of time elapses, it passes

ramble.英释: to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure

annual.英释: a plant that lives for one year or season

cosmic.英释: relating to space or the universe

unique.英释: being the only one of its kind

status.英释: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

shiver.英释: to shake slightly because you are cold or frightened

madden.英释: to make someone very angry or annoyed

cereal.英释: a breakfast food made from grain and usually eaten with milk

jungle.英释: a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together

hijack.英释: to use violence or threats to take control of a plane, vehicle, or ship

scrape.英释: to remove something from a surface using the edge of a knife, a stick etc

sicken.英释: to make you feel shocked and angry, especially because you strongly disapprove of something

statue.英释: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

occupy.英释: to live or stay in a place

propel.英释: to move, drive, or push something forward

liquor.英释: a strong alcoholic drink such as whisky

legend.中释: 传说，传奇，传奇文学；地图图例
legend.英释: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

origin.英释: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

fierce.中释: 凶猛的，狂热的，强烈的，愤怒的
fierce.英释: done with a lot of energy and strong feelings, and sometimes violence

famine.英释: a situation in which a large number of people have little or no food for a long time and many people die

grudge.英释: a feeling of dislike for someone because you cannot forget that they harmed you in the past

distil.英释: If a liquid such as whisky or water is distilled, it is heated until it changes into steam or vapour and then cooled until it becomes liquid again. This is usually done in order to make it pure.

crease.英释: to become marked with a line or lines, or to make a line appear on cloth, paper etc by folding or crushing it

embark.英释: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

puzzle.英释: to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something

subtle.中释: 微妙的；难以捉摸的；精明的
subtle.英释: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

pledge.英释: something valuable that you leave with someone else as proof that you will do what you have agreed to do

oppose.英释: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

ordeal.中释: (对品格或忍耐力的)严格考验

placid.英释: a placid person does not often get angry or upset and does not usually mind doing what other people want them to

sanity.中释: 心智健全，神智正常；判断正确
sanity.英释: the condition of being mentally healthy

sprint.英释: to run very fast for a short distance

cradle.中释: 摇篮，策源地；支船架vt把放在摇篮里
cradle.英释: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves gently from side to side

kidnap.英释: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

marrow.英释: the soft fatty substance in the hollow centre of bones

relief.英释: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

ransom.英释: an amount of money that is paid to free someone who is held as a prisoner

notary.英释: someone, especially a lawyer, who has the legal power to make a signed statement or document official

assure.英释: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

latent.英释: something that is latent is present but hidden, and may develop or become more noticeable in the future

varied.英释: consisting of or including many different kinds of things or people, especially in a way that seems interesting

thrill.英释: a sudden strong feeling of excitement and pleasure, or the thing that makes you feel this

review.英释: a careful examination of a situation or process

assign.中释: 分配；确定时间或地点；指派
assign.英释: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

shanty.英释: a small, roughly built hut made from thin sheets of wood,  tin  , plastic etc that very poor people live in

infant.英释: a baby or very young child

attain.英释: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

lethal.英释: causing death, or able to cause death

exhort.英释: to try very hard to persuade someone to do something

timber.英释: wood used for building or making things

maniac.英释: someone who behaves in a stupid or dangerous way

tangle.英释: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass

pillar.英释: somebody who is an important and respected member of a group, and is involved in many public activities

stroke.英释: if someone has a stroke, an  artery (= tube carrying blood )  in their brain suddenly bursts or becomes blocked, so that they may die or be unable to use some muscles

wither.中释: 使枯萎,使凋谢；使人感觉羞愧或迷惑 "
wither.英释: if plants wither, they become drier and smaller and start to die

trauma.英释: an unpleasant and upsetting experience that affects you for a long time

filter.英释: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment

fester.英释: if an unpleasant feeling or problem festers, it gets worse because it has not been dealt with

enrich.英释: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

equity.中释: 公平；公正；无固定利息的股票
equity.英释: a situation in which all people are treated equally and no one has an unfair advantage

detest.英释: to hate something or someone very much

incite.英释: to deliberately encourage people to fight, argue etc

export.英释: the business of selling and sending goods to other countries

carrot.英释: a long pointed orange vegetable that grows under the ground

linear.英释: consisting of lines, or in the form of a straight line

amends.英释: recompense or compensation given or gained for some injury, insult, etc

mighty.中释: 强大的，强有力的，巨大的，浩大的
mighty.英释: very strong and powerful, or very big and impressive

jumble.英释: a lot of different things mixed together in an untidy way, without any order

agency.英释: a business that provides a particular service for people or organizations

elated.英释: extremely happy and excited, especially because of something that has happened or is going to happen

porous.英释: allowing liquid, air etc to pass slowly through many very small holes

defile.英释: to make something less pure and good, especially by showing no respect

gravel.英释: small stones, used to make a surface for paths, roads etc

strain.英释: to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

nibble.英释: to eat small amounts of food by taking very small bites

script.中释: 手迹，笔迹; 手稿; 剧本

devote.英释: If you devote yourself, your time, or your energy to something, you spend all or most of your time or energy on it

fluent.中释: 说话流利的，(演说等)流畅的
fluent.英释: able to speak a language very well

design.英释: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

afford.英释: to provide something or allow something to happen

luxury.英释: very great comfort and pleasure, such as you get from expensive food, beautiful houses, cars etc

derive.英释: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something

detect.英释: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

devour.中释: 狼吞虎咽地吃；挥霍，耗尽
devour.英释: to eat something quickly because you are very hungry

update.英释: to make something more modern in the way it looks or operates

factor.英释: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

prompt.英释: to make someone decide to do something

divert.英释: to change the direction in which something travels

muddle.英释: to put things in the wrong order

harass.英释: to make someone’s life unpleasant, for example by frequently saying offensive things to them or threatening them

resent.英释: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

malice.英释: the desire to harm someone because you hate them

tumour.英释: a mass of diseased cells in your body that have divided and increased too quickly

coerce.英释: to force someone to do something they do not want to do by threatening them

credit.英释: to believe or admit that someone has a quality, or has done something good

rhythm.中释: 韵律，格律；有规律的反复(循环)，周期性
rhythm.英释: A rhythm is a regular pattern of changes, for example changes in your body, in the seasons, or in the tides

hazard.英释: something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

clause.英释: a part of a written law or legal document covering a particular subject of the whole law or document

output.英释: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc

finite.英释: having an end or a limit

mutter.英释: If you mutter, you speak very quietly so that you cannot easily be heard, often because you are complaining about something

impose.英释: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

hubbub.英释: a mixture of loud noises, especially the noise of a lot of people talking at the same time

tumble.中释: 跌倒，跌落；摇摇欲坠；使倾覆
tumble.英释: to fall down quickly and suddenly, especially with a rolling movement

patron.中释: 赞助人；资助人；老顾客，主顾
patron.英释: someone who supports the activities of an organization, for example by giving money

column.中释: 柱; 柱状物；书报上的栏；纵列
column.英释: a tall solid upright stone post used to support a building or as a decoration

deduct.英释: to take away an amount or part from a total

crouch.英释: to lower your body close to the ground by bending your knees completely

quench.英释: to stop a fire from burning

shovel.英释: to lift and move earth, stones etc with a shovel

saddle.英释: a leather seat that you sit on when you ride a horse

kindle.英释: if you kindle a fire, or if it kindles, it starts to burn

thirst.英释: the feeling of wanting or needing a drink

tender.英释: to make a formal offer to do a job or provide goods or services for a particular price

layout.英释: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged

outlet.中释: 河流等出口，出路；发泄(感情等)的方法
outlet.英释: a way of expressing or getting rid of strong feelings

tablet.英释: a small round hard piece of medicine which you swallow

starve.英释: to suffer or die because you do not have enough to eat

tunnel.英释: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through

thrust.英释: a sudden strong movement in which you push something forward

modify.英释: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

utmost.英释: You can use utmost to emphasize the importance or seriousness of something or to emphasize the way that it is done

regime.英释: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

assume.英释: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

Easter.英释: a Christian holy day in March or April when Christians remember the death of Christ and his return to life

deputy.英释: someone who is directly below another person in rank, and who is officially in charge when that person is not there

funnel.英释: to send money, information etc from various places to someone

shrink.英释: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

radius.中释: 半径；以半径度量的面积
radius.英释: the distance from the centre to the edge of a circle, or a line drawn from the centre to the edge

cellar.英释: a room under a house or other building, often used for storing things

mature.英释: to become fully grown or developed

shield.英释: to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged

greedy.英释: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

ascend.英释: to move up through the air

thrive.英释: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

vanity.英释: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance

object.英释: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

gloomy.英释: sad because you think the situation will not improve

cruise.英释: a holiday on a large ship

margin.中释: (页边)空白；边缘；(时间，金钱)多余
margin.英释: the edge of something, especially an area of land or water

depart.英释: to leave, especially when you are starting a journey

entail.英释: to involve something as a necessary part or result

ponder.英释: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

intent.中释: (目光)不能移的，集中的，专心的，坚决的
intent.英释: giving careful attention to something so that you think about nothing else

piston.英释: a part of an engine consisting of a short solid piece of metal inside a tube, which moves up and down to make the other parts of the engine move

mosaic.中释: 镶嵌细工的，镶嵌工艺品的，嵌花式的
mosaic.英释: a group of different things that exist next to each other or together

quarry.英释: a place where large amounts of stone or sand are dug out of the ground

gossip.中释: 流言蜚语；报上社会新闻；爱传流言的人
gossip.英释: information that is passed from one person to another about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including unkind or untrue remarks

obsess.英释: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

armour.英释: metal or leather clothing that protects your body, worn by soldiers in battles in past times

hamper.英释: to make it difficult for someone to do something

polish.英释: a liquid, powder, or other substance that you rub into a surface to make it smooth and shiny

cavity.英释: a hole or space inside something

murmur.英释: to make a soft low sound

tongue.英释: the soft part inside your mouth that you can move about and use for eating and speaking

rumour.英释: information or a story that is passed from one person to another and which may or may not be true

misuse.英释: to use something for the wrong purpose, or in the wrong way, often with harmful results

pierce.中释: 刺穿，戳人；（喻）寒冷刺骨；感动
pierce.英释: to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point

policy.英释: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

vulgar.中释: 粗俗的，趣味不高的，通俗的，庸俗的
vulgar.英释: remarks, jokes etc that are vulgar deal with sex in a very rude and offensive way

option.英释: a choice you can make in a particular situation

censor.英释: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous

detach.英释: if you detach something, or if it detaches, it becomes separated from the thing it was attached to

tumult.英释: a confused, noisy, and excited situation, often caused by a large crowd

ardent.英释: showing strong positive feelings about an activity and determination to succeed at it

uphold.英释: to defend or support a law, system, or principle so that it continues to exist

canvas.英释: strong cloth used to make bags, tents, shoes etc

favour.英释: If you favour someone, you treat them better or in a kinder way than you treat other people

molest.英释: to attack or harm someone, especially a child, by touching them in a sexual way or by trying to have sex with them

edible.英释: something that is edible can be eaten

sprout.英释: if vegetables, seeds, or plants sprout, they start to grow, producing  shoots  ,  buds  , or leaves

martyr.英释: If someone is martyred, they are killed or made to suffer greatly because of their religious or political beliefs

global.中释: 全世界的，全球的；综合的

revive.英释: When something such as the economy, a business, a trend, or a feeling is revived or when it revives, it becomes active, popular, or successful again

create.英释: to make something exist that did not exist before

detain.英释: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

notify.英释: to formally or officially tell someone about something

phobia.英释: a strong unreasonable fear of something

stereo.英释: a machine for playing records,  cds  etc that produces sound from two  speakers

lament.英释: a song, piece of music, or something that you say, that expresses a feeling of sadness

revise.英释: to change something because of new information or ideas

closet.英释: A closet is a very small room for storing things, especially one without windows

advent.英释: the time when something first begins to be widely used

menace.英释: something or someone that is dangerous

fossil.英释: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

ethnic.英释: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

sector.中释: 战区，防区；(工业等)部门，部分
sector.英释: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

differ.英释: to be different from something in some way

strive.英释: to make a great effort to achieve something

quiver.英释: to shake slightly because you are cold, or because you feel very afraid, angry, excited etc

tackle.英释: to try to deal with a difficult problem

estate.英释: law all of someone’s property and money, especially everything that is left after they die

recall.英释: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

compel.英释: to force someone to do something

shrewd.英释: good at judging what people or situations are really like

impair.英释: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

pathos.英释: the quality that a person, situation, film, or play has that makes you feel pity and sadness

namely.英释: used when saying the names of the people or things you are referring to

esteem.英释: a feeling of respect for someone, or a good opinion of someone

confer.英释: to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved

giggle.英释: to laugh quickly, quietly, and in a high voice, because something is funny or because you are nervous or embarrassed

escort.英释: to take someone somewhere, especially when you are protecting or guarding them

retain.英释: to keep something or continue to have something

delude.英释: to make someone believe something that is not true

inland.英释: in a direction away from the coast and towards the centre of a country

metric.英释: using or connected with the  metric system  of weights and measures

wrench.英释: to twist and pull something roughly from the place where it is being held

huddle.英释: a group of people or things that are close together, but not arranged in any particular order, pattern, or system

string.英释: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

dilute.英释: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid

storey.英释: a floor or level of a building

exceed.英释: to be more than a particular number or amount

summit.中释: 顶点，高峰；峰会(最高级会谈)

target.英释: something that you are trying to achieve, such as a total, an amount, or a time

rescue.英释: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm

smooth.英释: to make something such as cloth or hair flat by moving your hands across it

clumsy.英释: moving or doing things in a careless way, especially so that you drop things, knock into things etc

comedy.中释: 喜剧；一出喜剧，喜剧性事件
comedy.英释: entertainment that is intended to make people laugh

junior.英释: relating to sport for young people below a particular age

embody.英释: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

domain.英释: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

expand.英释: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

infest.中释: 大批出动，成群出现(鼠类及害虫)
infest.英释: if insects, rats etc infest a place, there are a lot of them and they usually cause damage

induce.英释: To induce a state or condition means to cause it

climax.英释: if a situation, process, or story climaxes, it reaches its most important or exciting part

remedy.英释: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better

throng.英释: if people throng a place, they go there in large numbers

deluge.英释: a large flood, or period when there is a lot of rain

sponge.英释: a piece of a soft natural or artificial substance full of small holes, which can suck up liquid and is used for washing

chapel.英释: a small church, or a room in a hospital, prison, big church etc in which Christians pray and have religious services

ignite.英释: to start burning, or to make something start burning

render.中释: 提供，报答；表演，演奏；翻译
render.英释: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

mutual.英释: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

dispel.英释: to make something go away, especially a belief, idea, or feeling

timely.英释: done or happening at exactly the right time

wisdom.中释: 智慧，才智；明智的思想言论
wisdom.英释: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

retort.英释: to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

adjust.英释: to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

extend.英释: to continue for a particular distance or over a particular area

anyhow.中释: 不论用何种方法；无论如何

impart.英释: to give a particular quality to something

appeal.英释: an urgent request for something important

outfit.英释: a set of clothes worn together, especially for a special occasion

impact.英释: the force of one object hitting another

coupon.中释: 证明持券人有某种权利的卡片，票证，赠券
coupon.英释: a small piece of printed paper that gives you the right to pay less for something or get something free

invest.英释: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

arctic.英释: The Arctic is the area of the world around the North Pole. It is extremely cold and there is very little light in winter and very little darkness in summer.

hinder.英释: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

commit.英释: to do something wrong or illegal

invert.英释: to put something in the opposite position to the one it was in before, especially by turning it upside down (= the bottom is on the top and the top is on the bottom )

sturdy.英释: an object that is sturdy is strong, well-made, and not easily broken

spring.英释: the season between winter and summer when leaves and flowers appear

scorch.英释: if you scorch something, or if it scorches, its surface burns slightly and changes colour

affect.英释: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation

pester.英释: to annoy someone, especially by asking them many times to do something

frugal.英释: careful to buy only what is necessary

series.英释: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

strait.英释: a narrow passage of water between two areas of land, usually connecting two seas

steady.英释: continuing or developing gradually or without stopping, and not likely to change

affirm.英释: If you affirm that something is true or that something exists, you state firmly and publicly that it is true or exists

preach.英释: to talk about a religious subject in a public place, especially in a church during a service

tariff.英释: a tax on goods coming into a country or going out of a country

genius.英释: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have

volume.英释: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

allege.英释: to say that something is true or that someone has done something wrong, although it has not been proved

expend.英释: To expend something, especially energy, time, or money, means to use it or spend it
